data.title: Recording Studio in Miami, Florida
data.meta_description: House of Hits is the city's premier high end recording studio. Featuring a 225 times platinum staff and 4 state of the art rooms.
data.text:
House of Hits Recording Studio Suites in Miami

Are you searching for a luxury recording studio in Miami? Well look no further, you have found the world’s first-ever recording experience and the top music studio in South Florida!

The House of Hits offers four unique studio rooms to meet your audio recording needs and fit your budget. Whatever room you choose, you can rest assured you’ll experience the best gear in the industry in an environment that will fuel your creativity. Each of our luxury recording studio rooms features large windows to see the musician in the vocal booth, along with seating to keep you comfortable during your recording session. Here’s a breakdown of the four rooms available at the House of Hits.

Experience Top-Of-The-Line Recording Capabilities in the Presidential Suite

Imagine a recording studio that can seat 10 people comfortably with awesome, sharp design and lighting by Bentley Mains to set the mood. It’s large enough to move around comfortably and features all the gear you’ve always dreamed of using. It contains an isolated vocal booth for the crisp capture of vocals and other sounds. Oh, and did we mention it has a real, decorated aquarium under the producer’s desk?

These features are some of what you’ll experience in the Presidential Suite. And with a price of $150 per hour, you’re definitely getting your money’s worth. Here’s a look at some of the incredible gear available to you in this studio room:

Sony C800G Tube Microphone

Neve 1073DPA

Tube-Tech CL 1B

Universal Audio Apollo x16

Audient ASP8024 Heritage Edition

Focal Twin6 Be

Dual 18″ low mids, dual 7″ mids, 1″ horn and dual 18″ subwoofers powered by the Powersoft T604

Audio Technica ATH-M50x headphones

Record Like a Pro in the House of Hits Master Suite

The Master Suite at the House of Hits gives artists another option for high-end recording with plenty of space to bring the whole crew. With an awesome curved design scheme and space for up to 10 people, you can lay down all the vocals or instruments you need for your track. And the best part is that it’s all recorded on some of the best studio gear in the business. An hourly rate of $125 gives you access to the following:

Manley Reference Cardioid Tube Microphone

BAE 73MPL in Rupert Neve Designs R6

Tube-Tech CL 1B

Universal Audio Apollo x16

Audient ASP8024 Heritage Edition

Avalon Designs VT737

Warm Audio WA2A

Focusrite 2

Focusrite 3

Focal Twin6 Be

Dual 18″ low mids, dual 7″ mids, 1″ horn and dual 18″ subwoofers powered by the Powersoft T604

Achieve Big Sound in a Small Room With the Executive Suite

At $80 per hour, the Executive Suite is a bargain recording solution that will yield radio-ready results. Let its curved design scheme and alluring vibe inspire you as you get behind the mic and lay down your next verse. You’ll have room for up to five people in the Executive Suite, making it one of the best-quality recording rooms for its size. Here’s some of the gear you’ll use:

Monheim Crème Tube Microphone

Neve 1073LB in Rupert Neve Designs R6

Warm Audio WA-2A

Universal Audio Apollo x6

Audient Nero Monitor Controller

Focal Twin6 Be with Sub6 11″ subwoofer

Avid Dock with 2 Avid S1

Audio Technica ATH-M50x headphones

Enjoy Affordable Rates and Excellent Recording Gear in the Guest Suite

The Guest Suite brings back the sharp, angular design and pairs it with a bold color scheme to boost your energy during your next recording session. With room for five people and a price of $90, the Guest Suite is a fantastic option for recording your upcoming demo, single, EP or album. Here’s some of the gear included in the Guest Suite:

Neumann U87ai

Neve 1073 SPX

Empirical Labs Distressor

Burl B2 Bomber

Dangerous Music Source

Universal Audio Apollo 16

Allen & Heath GL3300

Yamaha HS5 White

Augspurger Solo 12MF 12″ mains with dual Sub18 18″ subwoofers powered by Augspurger Power SXE-3D

Audio Technica ATH-M50x headphones

Discounts for 8+ hour recording session blocks are available if schedule permits contact us today for more info.

For additional information regarding booking or services provided at our Miami recording studio call 305-907-3440 or scroll down for address and location. Currently, we are only accepting sessions by appointment. We do not accept walk-ins or tours out of respect to those who are recording.

Recording Studio In Miami Florida

Do you need a world-class recording studio in Miami, Florida? Whether for your mix-tape, extended play, references or a full-length album recording, our best-in-class Miami music recording studios will make your next hit sound the way it is supposed to.

We offer the first and only “Recording Experience”, which includes a new-age vibe and a high-end art gallery. We are committed to providing the experience of a lifetime while offering some of the best prices in Miami.

We understand what it means to come up with a creative piece and require the right studio to transform your intellectual property to the most valuable content in the musical industry. Our association with people all over the globe has enabled us to see the very best of creativity in display and understand how to infuse what we know in other projects.

The studios we use are considered to be the best recording studios in Miami, and they are specifically built to handle mixing, recording and mastering. The cost of recording ranges from $70.00 per hour with a negotiable rate for 8-hour time blocks and upwards at the House Of Hits.

Choosing our service enables our clients to enjoy the very best of audio recording. Our team possesses the required experience that covers areas such as hip-hop, jazz, contemporary, folk/rock, metal, ska, and others.

If you need a “recording studio near me” in Miami or a Miami music production service, then you are definitely at the right place because our clients always end up having a good story to tell about the fantastic service that we render. You can contact us to book an appointment with us, and we will be glad to give you the best Miami has to offer. For a list of the top 5 recording studios in Miami Florida, we have you covered!

FAQ FOR MUSIC RECORDING STUDIOS

Some frequently asked questions regarding music recording and their answers are below.

What Is the Recording Process Like?

The process is basically not difficult or technical for you as an artist. Normally an artist will speak into a microphone that converts the sound into electrical energy which is received and also sent back to the artist via the headphones worn. The acoustic instrument we have records the sound from the microphone while we listen to the sound and evaluate the output for quality.

How Much Is a Studio Session?

Studio session prices start at $70.00 per hour without an engineer. Studios in Miami often have different recording rooms, each with its own rates. House of Hits offers four unique suite options that provide an experience! An individual that considers working 8+ hours or more may be eligible for a discount on their studio time, feel free to get in touch with us if for additional information.

How Is Your Recording Studio Built?

Our recording studio is built to standard with good acoustic treatment. Different materials were utilized to either reflect or absorb sound in the studio. So basically, the physical structure is also designed to give a recording artist the best possible outcome from his studio time.

Why Should I Consider Using a Professional Recording Studio?

There are different reasons why you need a professional studio just like ours. We have the right physical structure that supports good acoustics, top-notch equipment, and an experienced engineer to help you get the best possible recording outcome.

How Do You Guys Make Money?

Our pricing is used for both individual artists, bands, and corporate entities. So we get involved in the recording of different contents for different brands and individuals. Some of our clients consider us as the best recording studio in Miami, so we find it reasonable to attend to clients with various purposes of engaging in music production and sound recording.

How Do I Know When to Visit the Studio for a Recording Session?

Every studio session is by appointment. Usually, when you contact us and make demands on the number of hours you need, we will arrange for a time that is convenient for both parties. Once that is done, you will be able to have your session at the appointed time. Also, please note that it is important to be at the studio location a few minutes before the appointed time for recording.

Do You Have a Recording Staff, or Is it Self-Service?

Yes, one or more recording staff will be present to assist you to enjoy your recording in Miami. Some other activities that our staff can handle include; mastering and mixing the audio, recording a video, especially for those that want to capture the moment spent exploring the recording equipment.

What Is the Task of a Recording Studio Engineer?

The person that handles the task of evaluating your recording for quality is the studio engineer, also known as the audio engineer. The studio engineer also works closely with the artist to select the best possible outcome from a recording session. The studio engineer will most likely work with you to select the best out of 3 different recordings.

Should I Expect My Label to Handle the Cost of Studio Sessions?

Labels are more interested in recordings that go viral, and not the recordings you are still working on. This means it is important to prepare for handling the cost of all studio recordings.

Choose the House of Hits for Your Music Recording Needs

Want to book your next recording session in one of our Miami recording studio rooms? Contact us today to book your time!
